intro: Tetratheca affinis var. platycaula, commonly known as the broad-stemmed tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and heathlands. This variety is distinguished by its broader stems and leaves compared to other varieties within the species.
